intro: Eleutherococcus divaricatus f. inermis, commonly known as the smoothleaf eleuthero, is a rare variant of the eleuthero plant native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its smooth, undivided leaves and smaller, less showy flowers compared to the typical species. The plant thrives in shaded, moist forest environments, often growing in mountainous regions. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is valued for its adaptability to challenging ecological conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
